content:
Welcome to #CCDA / FHIR mapping stream.

Description: CCDA / FHIR Mapping project admin
@all I have created this stream for administration relating to the CCDA / FHIR mapping.
understood. thanks for this
we'll have to discuss what goes here and what goes public. but for now, I've done 2 thigns:
the CDA logical model is committed to https://github.com/HL7/fhir-cda
that's an IG but it's not set up to publish yet. I'll be working on that.
there's some initial maps, enough for a round-trip of the test sling, in the CCDA-on-FHIR implementation guide
well, these things will be there as long as the useless hotel network stays yup long enough for me to commit
the schema that came with the logical model wouldn't validate. i'm not sure if it was meant to?
it won't validate an unmodified CDA document because of limitations of schema and/or the mismatch between the type system of a logical model, schema, and the V3 type model.

the reasons it won't validate do not mean that the logical model itself is wrong, and they won't be a problem, with the possible exception of doseQuantity - I haven't figured out the in-place downgrade of IVL<PQ> to PQ yet
the latter - the declared namespaces are inconsistent. i agree that the schema isn't necessary for the logical model.
what's wring with the namespaces?
have you looked at the before/after validating cda document?

you declare targetNamespace="urn:hl7-org:v3" in the ClinicalDocument.xsd but you import the fhir schema that has a declared targetNamespace="http://hl7.org/fhir" Those are inconsistent and give you an invalid schema.
then you're not looking at the right version
where are you looking?
i'm looking at what Wayne sent me.
then look at what just committed to github above
okay. thanks for the update

and if that's still a problem, all I can say is:
- it reads ok from the schmea spec
- xmlspy says it's ok
- lloyd says its ok. (and I'm about to go offline for a while - touring in Rome - so follow ups to @Lloyd McKenzie )
no, that is fine now.
thanks and have fun
good. I will. Colosseum today..
